name: chicagotribune
text:
Chicago police prepare for Election Day unrest, Pat O’Brien outpaces Kim Foxx in fundraising, and Pritzker’s state income tax bill would rise to $10.5 million under graduated tax plan.

Here are today’s top stories in Chicago politics, from @byldonovan: https://t.co/QBvEwlSJt0

name: chicagotribune
text:
RT @ChicagoSports: If you think Las Vegas oddsmakers hold the Bears in low esteem, you are correct.

And it might not end anytime soon, @BradBiggs writes.

https://t.co/uZWKxsJbCL

name: chicagotribune
text: RT @chitribopinions: We demand more than diversity. Many storied institutions have made their fortune through racist acts. Remedying that fact requires honest acknowledgment of the past, and well-resourced actions in the present, Adrienne R. Brown and Eve L. Ewing write. https://t.co/5fBf1U8loV

name: chicagotribune
text: Everest, a four-star Chicago restaurant since 1986, will close permanently at the end of the year, but not because of the pandemic. https://t.co/6wP1vYPTpP

name: chicagotribune
text: A 26-year-old man was denied bail Friday for the fatal shooting of 20-year-old Brian Carrion in Evanston near the Howard Red Line station over the summer. https://t.co/UfsM8ZJh2f

name: chicagotribune
text: Illinois House Speaker Michael Madigan’s main campaign fund has continued footing the bill for legal fees related to an ongoing federal corruption probe even as it and 3 other funds he controls spend heavily to support other state Democratic candidates. https://t.co/k35WlM3mTv

name: chicagotribune
text: Northwestern University’s Kellogg School of Management is suspending in-person classes for two weeks after four students who attended recent off-campus gatherings tested positive for COVID-19 https://t.co/XuDhwHAFa3

name: chicagotribune
text: Sinclair Broadcast will remove commentary in its latest “America This Week” program that is dismissive of mask-wearing after facing backlash over the comments from the show's host Eric Bolling https://t.co/ijXpZdkpPh
